paper_abstract: Completing Aronov et al.'s study on zero-discrepancy matrices for digital halftoning, we determine all (m,n,k,l) for which it is possible to put mn consecutive integers on an mxn board (with wrap-around) so that each kxl region has the same sum. For one of the cases where this is impossible, we give a heuristic method to find a matrix with small discrepancy.
paper_title: Generalized Semimagic Squares for Digital Halftoning
